{{Out of date|section|date=October 2009}}
A number of vendors offer computers with Ubuntu pre-installed. [[Dell]], [[Tesco]],<ref>{{cite web | url=http://direct.tesco.com/q/R.200-6129.aspx | title=Tesco Shipping Desktops with Ubuntu - eSys ePC|accessdate=2008-06-02|publisher=[[Tesco]]}}</ref> and [[Gliese IT]] have provided this option since 2007, while [[System76]] has done so since November 2005.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dell.com/content/topics/segtopic.aspx/linux_3x?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs | title=Ubuntu Customers | accessdate=2008-08-19|publisher=[[Dell, Inc]]}}</ref> In June 2008, a South African company, [[Bravium Computers]], was incorporated and modeled on System76, offering South Africans the opportunity to purchase computers pre-installed with Ubuntu.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://shop.bravium.co.za/what-is-ubuntu | title=Ubuntu Computers | accessdate=2009-04-23 | publisher=[[Bravium Computers]]}}</ref> Dell and System76 customers are able to choose between 30-day, three-month, and yearly Ubuntu support plans through Canonical.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/system76-certified-servers | title=System76 announces servers with Ubuntu 7.10 and Canonical support services | accessdate=2008-03-05|publisher=[[Canonical Ltd.]]}}</ref> Dell offers Ubuntu-driven computers for sale in Canada, France, Germany, [[Latin America]], Spain, United Kingdom and United States.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ubuntu.com/dell | title=Ubuntu on Dell | accessdate=2008-02-24|publisher=[[Canonical Ltd.]]}}</ref> In addition to the standard Ubuntu installation, select Dell machines running Ubuntu 7.10 and 8.04 come with proprietary DVD playback capabilities using [[LinDVD]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.desktoplinux.com/news/NS7924076658.html|title=Dell announces Ubuntu 7.10 PCs with DVD playback (UPDATED)<!-- Bot generated title -->|accessdate=2008-06-02|publisher=DesktopLinux}}</ref> Dell computers running Ubuntu 8.04 include extra support for [[ATI]] Video Graphics, Dell Wireless, [[Fingerprint Readers]], [[HDMI]], [[Bluetooth]] and [[MP3]]/[[WMA]]/[[WMV]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://yourblog.dell.com/2008/07/18/dell-upgrades-consumer-linux-pcs-to-ubuntu-804/ |title=Your Blog Â» Blog Archive Â» Dell Upgrades Consumer Linux PCs to Ubuntu 8.04 |publisher=Dell.com |date= |accessdate=2008-09-13}}</ref>

==Errors with SIS Mirage 3 chip==
  â   â
The SIS Mirage 3 chip does not allow 3D graphics, which forces the screen display in a 800x600 size. <ref>http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=958967&highlight=SIS+Mirage+3</ref>
